intro.title: Is evil necessary for good to exist?
intro.description: Do we need to try what is bad in order to value what is good? This is an existential dilemma that especially bothers the parents when their children try to claim their right to experience what they shouldn’t, only to know if that is indeed bad. The Bible says that God created everything perfectly so that man could enjoy this condition forever.

appendix.appendixContent:
Isaiah 45:18

18 For thus says the Lord, Who created the heavens, Who is God, Who formed the earth and made it, Who has established it, Who did not create it in vain, Who formed it to be inhabited: “I am the Lord, and there is no other.

questions.description: “The Earth was created to be inhabited”, says Isaiah 45:18, and not to become chaos. In the divine project, evil was never a part of it, not even to validate the experience of good. Everything was designed to be perfectly good, and human beings had all the conditions necessary to be eternally happy.
questions.questionTitle: Regarding evil and its relation to the divine project of humankind, mark true or false on the following statements.

answers.text: Evil has always been in God’s plans
God uses evil to validate the experience of good
The land was created to be inhabited
In the divine project, evil was never part of it

appendix.appendixContent:
Genesis 2:16

16 And the Lord God commanded the man, saying, “Of every tree of the garden you may freely eat;

questions.description: Adam and Eve were created in a garden, according to the account of Genesis 1 and 2, where all that was created was good. That’s how God signed all His work. They were challenged to live obediently, not eating the forbidden fruit, but enjoying all the other fruits and good experiences available to them (Genesis 2:16). Therefore, their ability to choose not to eat the forbidden fruit and continue to be obedient to God’s Word was a reality, which makes the existence of evil unnecessary. To try to explain the existence of evil is to justify it, and it can never be justified.
questions.questionTitle: Adam and Eve had the choice not to eat the fruit and remain obedient. This makes the existence of evil:

appendix.appendixContent:
Numbers 23:19

19 “God is not a man, that He should lie, Nor a son of man, that He should repent. Has He said, and will He not do? Or has He spoken, and will He not make it good?

Numbers 23:19

19 “God is not a man, that He should lie, Nor a son of man, that He should repent. Has He said, and will He not do? Or has He spoken, and will He not make it good?

questions.description: The Bible says God created everything perfect (Genesis 1:31), and His intention was for everything to remain perfect. However, if in order to keep this state of perfection mankind had to trust God’s Word while obeying His commands, and such an action were still not possible, then the existence of evil would be necessary, and God would be a liar. However, the Bible categorically states that He is not (Numbers 23:19).
questions.questionTitle: To consider necessary the existence of evil is to believe that God has lied. In this regard, review the sentences below and choose the correct alternative.

answers.text: Lying is not Always a bad thing
